function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Lack of spillover effects in the sem model","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Age-related reduced travel leading to containment effect on covid-19 cases in neighboring areas.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High mobility of dependents across county borders leading to positive spillover effects of covid-19 cases.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Increased patient traffic across regional borders due to density of doctors leading to positive spillover effects of covid-19 cases.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Spillover effects of variables on covid-19 infections and deaths.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of spatial econometric models to capture indirect spillover effects.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High density of pupils and small children in kindergartens can contribute to the spread of infections.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Absence of regular testing for children in the national testing strategy can lead to undetected cases in schools and day care centers.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of systematically collected data on tests performed by age group and region can limit the understanding of infection patterns among children.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lower proportion of tests performed among 0-4 year olds","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lower positive rate for 0-4 year olds compared to overall positive rate","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Tendency in the current body of research to suggest that schools and daycare centers are not seen as drivers of covid-19 caseloads","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Uncontrolled situation in children’s homes leading to increased risk of contagion","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Cross-regional spread of infections due to schools and childcare","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Nursing homes as hotspots of covid-19 dissemination","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Spillover effects between neighboring districts leading to a containment effect on neighboring regions","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Export of infections across regional borders","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Interdependent infection channels at the population level","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Reversal of protective effects at the population level","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Possible influence of other health variables, such as specialist density or development of hospital care over the last 5 years, had practically no impact on our results.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Unclear unobserved positive rate among asymptomatic children","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inconsistent use of research evidence in informing decisions","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Top-down approach to decision-making with political and economic considerations taking precedence over research and health directives","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Disruption of health systems and economies","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Rapid spread of covid-19","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Tension between rigor and speed may lead to the dissemination of unverified or non-scientific evidence.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Relevant evidence may exist but decision-makers may be unaware or unable to interpret or apply it to their own context.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Decision-makers are influenced by numerous forces, including institutional constraints, political context, interest group pressures, and personal convictions.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Infodemics and fake news spreading at an unprecedented speed and reach, making it challenging to find trustworthy sources and reliable information.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of cross-sectoral dialogue and collaboration, leading to siloed approaches in public health crisis response.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of coordinated multi-sectoral actions to mitigate public health crisis impact","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of monitoring the effectiveness of prevention and mitigation measures during a crisis","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited capacity for evidence-informed policy-making in middle-income countries","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of trust in evidence and critical linkages between stakeholders","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Rapid response service may deliver low-quality evidence due to time constraints and urgency, leading to incorrect decision-making.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of flexibility and capability in kt platforms to switch to rapid response mode during a crisis.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient resources and funding for operationalizing the rapid response service, leading to delays and inadequacies in evidence provision.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Kt platform not providing trustworthy evidence during the pandemic","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Failure to educate and raise awareness in vulnerable groups about covid-19","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of responsiveness to changing priorities and needs","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High level of uncertainty associated with a pandemic","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Failure to identify context-specific knowledge gaps and priorities","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of vigilance in monitoring changes in the health system and social media","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of clarity on roles and responsibilities for pandemic response","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Failure of top-down approach in achieving desired impact for covid-19","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Scarcity of research and scientific uncertainties during pandemics","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on single case studies and observational studies as best available evidence","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on indirect evidence from related viruses like influenza, sars, and ebola for policy response","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on non-peer-reviewed sources for evidence","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Fragmentation of evidence base","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"}]}
